name: Mor Kuzhambu
history: Mor Kuzhambu is a traditional South Indian dish, particularly popular in Tamil Nadu and Kerala. It's similar to the North Indian Kadhi and is made using yogurt and coconut, making it a comforting and tangy dish.
description: Mor Kuzhambu is a yogurt-based curry enriched with coconut and spiced with green chilies and cumin. It typically includes vegetables like okra or ash gourd, offering a perfect balance of tangy, creamy, and spicy flavors.

instructions.title: Prepare the Coconut Paste
instructions.description: Grind the grated coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds into a smooth paste.

instructions.title: Cook the Vegetables
instructions.description: In a pan, heat a little oil and cook the okra or ash gourd with turmeric and salt until they are soft.

instructions.title: Combine Ingredients
instructions.description: Add the coconut paste to the cooked vegetables. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Add Yogurt
instructions.description: Lower the heat and add the beaten yogurt to the pan. Stir continuously until the mixture is warm but not boiling.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: In a small pan, heat the remaining oil. Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. When they start to splutter, add curry leaves and pour this over the curry.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Mor Kuzhambu hot with rice.

tips: Ensure not to boil the curry after adding yogurt to prevent it from curdling.
You can adjust the amount of green chilies based on your preferred spice level.
variations: Add different vegetables like pumpkin or brinjal for variation.
For a no-onion no-garlic version, simply skip these ingredients.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be refrigerated for 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat gently on the stove over low heat, stirring frequently.

presentationTips: Garnish with a sprig of curry leaves for a fresh look.
Serve in a traditional ceramic bowl for an authentic presentation.
